snippet: A storm that poured more than 13 inches of rain flooded major roads and prompted some families in the area to leave their homes.
abstract: Storm wreaks havoc on Long Island, dropping 13.27 inches of rain in less than 24 hours; record-breaking deluge brings down trees, prompts evacuations of homes and floods roads, with drivers abandoning their vehicles to escape rapidly rising water.

byline.original: By MARC SANTORA and ARIELLE DOLLINGER

lead_paragraph: A storm that poured more than 13 inches of rain flooded major roads and prompted some families in the area to leave their homes.

headline.main: Rain on Long Island Breaks a Record, Floods Highways and Sets Cars Afloat
headline.print_headline: Rain on Long Island Breaks a Record, Floods Highways and Sets Cars Afloat
